body.title: Multi-type props defined without value gets empty string, should be true [Boolean, String]
body.body:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/realcarbonneau/68w22cbo/](https://jsfiddle.net/realcarbonneau/68w22cbo/)

### Steps to reproduce
Define a multi-type Boolean and String Prop, call the component by specifying the prop name (without a value).

### What is expected?
Prop contains true (Boolean type)

### What is actually happening?
Prop contains an empty string

---
The sequence does not change the result, both `[Boolean, String]` and `[String, Boolean]` give the same result.  The version does not change the result either (vue version 1.0.12, 2.2.1, edge on jsfiddle)

body.title: beforeUpdate() is actually executed AFTER render()
body.body:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/5vze74yy/](https://jsfiddle.net/5vze74yy/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Add render() and beforeUpdate() hook to the instance.
2. Trigger data value change by any means

### What is expected?
Per the API

https://vuejs.org/v2/api/index.html#beforeUpdate

beforeUpdate is supposed to be fired before render(), and state changes in this hook should not trigger additional re-renders.

### What is actually happening?
beforeUpdate() is actually invoked after render() in current version 2.5.13.

---
This could result in infinite update loop, as state changes in beforeUpdate() will trigger another re-rendering.

body.title: Double value appear in textarea when using render function to create in .vue file.
Template renderer and CSP
body.body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
When context with state is provided to the template renderer an [inline script is created](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/f2b476d4f4f685d84b4957e6c805740597945cde/src/server/template-renderer/index.js#L199).  It may be useful to provide a nonce that gets attached to the script tag so an unsafe-inline CSP doesn't have to be enabled.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```
renderer.renderToString({
  state: {},
  nonce: ''
})
```

body.body:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/dbFlower/vue-hackernews-2.0](https://github.com/dbFlower/vue-hackernews-2.0)

### Steps to reproduce
Clone the repo, and then `npm i`, `npm run dev`.   view source code of `http://localhost:8080` . 
`/dist/static/test/for/plugin/bug/test-for-vue-ssr-bug.js` is prefetched by client plugin.

### What is expected?
All resources copied by CopyWebpackPlugin shouldn't be prefetched.

### What is actually happening?
Client plugin prefetches all the resources copied by CopyWebpackPlugin.

    new VueSSRClientPlugin(),

]

body.title: fix(inject): hasOwn instead of 'in' (fix #7284)
body.body:
The issue was caused by the [`in` operator check](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/src/core/instance/inject.js#L55) to see if an injection exists in a parent provide.

In the particular Issue, the injection didn't work because the the Symbol polyfill adds a setter to the Object prototype for every Symbol created and the `in`-operator check evaluated to true on any object inheriting Object. [Demo](http://jsfiddle.net/hirokiosame/dronjdzm/23/)

However, I'm thinking the implications of using `in` may be further reaching as it could have been any native prototype property. [Here](http://jsfiddle.net/hirokiosame/dronjdzm/24/) I demonstrate using the string `'constructor'` leads to unexpected injection behavior.

Although this fixes #7284, I am framing this as a fix for prototype properties being injected.

body.title: Add "cloneSlot" directive.
body.body:
### What problem does this feature solve? Take a child component (through the default slot) and recursively clone it allowing the user to define a child "sample" in a declarative way. Consider for example the following template declaration: ```javascript ``` The "formset-manager" component takes a "formset-row" definition as an "example". Internally it should clone as many "formset-row" components as the user demands (Note that not only a plain "formset-row" component should be cloned but its children as well, that means that the sample provided should be cloned recursively). I was unable to get or build a clean solution for this use case using scoped slots. I believe that the solution for this use case implies that the user needs to fully implement a the render function for the "formset-manager" component. ### What does the proposed API look like? The proposed API could look something like this (for the following template also consider the previously described "formset-manager" template): ```javascript const template = `
`; ``` The key to the above example is the proposed "cloneSlot" directive. For the above shown example it takes a "formset-row" child and clones it an arbitrary number of times (in this case dictated by the v-for). The "rows" used in the "cloneSlot" is defined in "data" (so when "rows" changes the appropriate number of "formset-rows" are cloned/generated).

body.title: Bind implementation is slower when native in modern browsers
body.body:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsperf.com/vue-bind-perf](https://jsperf.com/vue-bind-perf)

### Steps to reproduce
Run tests across some modern browsers to see the result.

### What is expected?
Custom bind implementation performance is the same level as native.

### What is actually happening?
Custom bind implementation performance is lower than native.

---
Tested in:
* Safari - native is **slower 83%**
* Chrome - native is **faster 61%**
* Edge - native is **faster 91%**
* Firefox - native is **faster 52%**

I believe it is not an issue at all, but I think it is something which can be improved.

body.title: [SSR] Support inline resource for specified files for server side rendering.
body.body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
When we are using SSR with CommonsChunkPlugin, we often generate a `manifest.js` at the same time, but `manifest.js` is always very small (about 1kb).

Without SSR using `html-webpack-plugin` and its inline resource plugin, we are able to make `manifest.js` transformed inline into html file.

But for now we can not do for SSR that because the html output is generated by `vue-server-render` automatically.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```js
createBundleRenderer(bundle, {
  inlineResources: [] // string or RegExp
})
```

body.title: Accept DOMElement in createElement Arguments
body.body: ### What problem does this feature solve? Many data visualization and graphics library do DOM manipulation and most of them the DOMElement can be extracted. ```js const rect = SVG.adopt(this.$refs.rect.elm) rect.node // this is the SVGElement and in chrome console will output ``` Let's say we want to build an abstraction by design it as a component that can draw a rectangle and after the drawing is done (by hold&drag mouse button) that rectangle will be placed in another section. The usage will be like this: ```html ``` and `` will be like this ```html ``` After the drawing is done, the rectangle will be moved and fill it with black (or SVG texture for the more complex case). This can be done by clone the element in `drawing` slots to `annotation` slot. ```js const rect = SVG.adopt(this.$slots.drawing[0].elm) rect.on('click', event => doDrawingLogic(event)) rect.on('drawfinish', event => { // the reason to clone and move slot is so any logic in annotation slot can be applied // the clone itself is to preserve `` so that it can be referenced again /** some logic here */ }) ``` In that case there is need to make createElement accept DOMElement for duplicating or maybe also converting Node to VNode. ```js newRect = newRect.clone().animate().dmove(100, 100) const clone = this.$createElement(newRect.node) this.$slots.annotation.push(clone) ``` > In above example, if createElement act as creating element then there will be 2 rectangles lol ### What does the proposed API look like? Basic usage ```js const div = document.getElementById("myDiv") this.$createElement(div) ``` Clone and move from 1 slots to another slot ```js const clone = this.$createElement(this.$slots.mySlot[0].elm) this.$slots.default.push(clone) ```

body.title: Vue not parsing prop names with numbers?
body.body:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/JosephusPaye/yqnjyq1k/2/](https://jsfiddle.net/JosephusPaye/yqnjyq1k/2/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Run the linked fiddle: https://jsfiddle.net/JosephusPaye/yqnjyq1k/2/
2. Check the result to see that the prop with a number isn't parsed
3. Verify this by inspecting with devtools, the prop is attached to the element as an attribute.

### What is expected?
The prop, `use24hrFormat` (`use-24hr-format`) should be parsed and the value in the component should be `true`.

### What is actually happening?
The prop is not parsed and the value in the component is the default value, `false`.

---
Hi,

I'm working on a time picker (using a SFC) and want to have a Boolean prop to determine whether to use 24-hour format for the time or not. However, using the prop `use24hrFormat` and the template equivalent `use-24hr-format` doesn't seem to be working. When I switch to other props, for example `useMilitaryTime`, it works fine.

I'm thinking this has something to do with the number in the prop name. Maybe using numbers in prop names like this is not supported, but I wasn't able to find anything about this in the docs.

Thanks for your time.

body.title: Tweening progress bar size behaves poorly due to .progress-bar css transition
body.body:
Doing short updates on the progress bar (in 4.0.0-beta.3) causes unexpected and ugly behavior due to the built-in [css transition on the progress bar](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/671bb27/scss/_progress.scss#L23). This happens when using a jQuery `animate()` or `TWEEN` (or anything) for **short tweens**. There is no bootstrap-friendly way of turning off the progress bar forced css transition, short of overriding the class, which makes it a poor choice for short progress transitions. I suggest having the css transition be an optional class on the progress bar, instead of built into it. --- With the css transition enabled, running a 3 second animation is sluggish and ends way before the end of the progress bar: ![progress-with-transition](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/438465/35183840-0defc602-fdb2-11e7-9f03-976080b5acb2.gif) As you can see, it drags behind what the percentage is, and then ends long before the 100%. If I don't set the width back to 0 at the end, it leaps from around 70% to 100% at the end of the tween. --- After disabling the css transition it animates properly: ![progress-without-transition](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/438465/35183877-85d0b67c-fdb2-11e7-9c01-b00db27e944d.gif) --- Example code: ```html
```

body.title: Skip validation feedback on certain inputs
body.body:
**Note 1**: I know that questions don't go in issues, but I haven't had any luck in Stackoverflow or Slack üò¢
**Note 2**: This is a duplicate from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48312772/skip-validation-feedback-on-certain-bootstrap-4-inputs so feel free to close this issue if you can help me there

-------

By following Bootstrap's docs on form validation, I can validate my forms, but I haven't found a way so that specific fields (e.g. a text input or a checkbox) don't show validation feedback while all of the others do.

What I mean is: how can I make that some specific fields either skip getting the `:valid` or `:invalid` pseudoclasses when the form is validated, or even if they do get the pseudoclasses applied to them, how can I skip them from being visually formatted as the other fields?

Maybe there is a class that acts as the opposite of `.was-validated` that can be applied to specific fields?

body.title: Touch target sizing/spacing
body.body:
A key accessibility and usability concept is to provide large enough click/touch targets.

Apple, Google, etc. have recommendations on touch target sizing/spacing.

From [Google's Material Design guidelines](https://material.io/guidelines/layout/metrics-keylines.html#metrics-keylines-sizing-by-increments):

> To ensure balanced information density and usability, touch targets should be at least 48 x 48 dp. In most cases, there should be 8dp or more space between them.
>
> Size elements at least 48dp high and wide to ensure a physical size of about 9mm regardless of screen size. The recommended target size for touchscreen objects is 7-10mm.

Bootstrap should incorporate the possibility of this sizing and spacing through Utilities.

For example, if I'm making a button group or button toolbar, I want to ensure that the buttons are spaced properly in line with usability recommendations (at a minimum), and that the buttons themselves are a minimum size to make them easily clickable/touchable.

## Current behavior When you catch errors returned for Http requests the `error.headers.keys()` only contains `pragma, content-type, cache-control, expires`. It excludes X-Powered-By and other X prefixed attributes from the response header. I'm unaware if the headers are filtered with a positive list or if the browser for some reason does the restriction. ## Expected behavior Any `X-` response header attribute would be in the `error.headers`. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions this.slxHttp.post(Urls.postDepartmentDataUrl, action.payload) .map(payload => ({ type: AccountActions.department_data_change_result.name, payload })) .catch(makeActionErrorObservableCatcher(AccountActions.customer_profile_error.name, 'account-undefined-error'))); ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? body.title: Remove experimental flag from stable APIs
body.body:
A lot of our APIs stay flagged as "experimental" because we never check if we should change it.
Before each major release, we should ask each component owner to remove the experimental flag from APIs that have been around for more than 1 version.
For example almost everything in i18n is flagged experimental.

@StephenFluin @IgorMinar what do you think about that?

body.title: feat(ivy): add afterContentInit and afterContentChecked to render3
body.body:
This PR adds support for the `afterContentInit` and `afterContentChecked` hooks to render3. It also adds some missing tests for how projected components will work with other lifecycle hooks.

Notes:
 - `afterContentInit` and `afterContentChecked` hooks are queued in `LView.contentHooks` during `elementEnd()`, then called after embedded views are processed in the first `r()` run of the view.
   - These hooks can't be called in the existing`Comp.h()` or `Comp.r()` functions if we want to maintain a backwards-compatible call order. Init hooks must *all* be called for a specific view before calling any content hooks and all content hooks must be called for a view before any of its children. 
   - Because `afterContentInit` hooks are called in a slightly different order than `onInit`, we cannot use simply queue the hooks in `Comp.h()` either (as we did with `afterViewInit` in `Comp.r()`). To ensure the content hooks for projected components are executed first, we queue the hooks in `elementEnd`. 
- `afterContentInit` hooks are "spliced" out of the `contentHooks` array after the first run, using the same algorithm used for the view hooks. This trades a bit more time in creation mode to avoid iterating over "dead" hooks in every change detection run.
- To fix `onDestroy` call order with projected components, `onDestroy` declarations have been moved out of the factory function and into `elementEnd` as well.

body.title: github robot should rebase a PR when special label is added.
body.body:
When a repo collaborator applies a label "PR action: rebase" the robot should:
- rebase the PR on top of the HEAD of the *target* branch (the target might differ because of our patch branches)
- force push into the PR branch
- leave a comment on the PR that the PR was rebased as requested by @<username>
- remove the "PR action: rebase" label

github bot: mark PRs with a google3 status
body.body:
@ocombe here's how it should work:

whenever a PR has the merge label applied, or a new SHA is pushed to a PR with the merge label
1) get the head SHA
2) if that sha has no status with google3 context, then 
  a) if the PR affects any of these files
```
include = [
        "BUILD.bazel",
        "LICENSE",
        "WORKSPACE",
        "modules/**",
        "packages/**",
    ],
    exclude = [
        "packages/language-service/**",
        "**/.gitignore",
        "**/.gitkeep",
    ],
```
 then push a `'{"state":"pending", "context":"google3", "description": "Verifying this change in google3"}'` status to it
   b) otherwise push a `{"state":"success", "context":"google3", "description": "Does not affect google3"}` status to it
